sentences.sentence: A massive Russian attack has struck Ukraine, killing five people and leaving 40 more injured, say the country's emergency services.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ground staff full of FANZA have gone on strike at five major German airports, causing the airline to cancel hundreds of flights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: A massive Russian attack with drones and missiles has burned down people's homes across Ukraine. The attacks targeted three major cities, including the capital Kyiv, where at least four people

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: were killed, including a woman who was pregnant, said Ukrainian emergency services.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Another man was also killed in Mykolayiv.

sentences.sentence: More than 40 people have been reported injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: І за цього ми вийшли подивитися вже після закінчення повітряної тривоги.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Two power lines damaged left some residents on Kyiv's east bank without electricity. In the southern city of Mygolaiv, some 20 residential buildings and public infrastructure were damaged.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's armed forces said they intercepted 44 drones and missiles out of 64 that were launched in the morning attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Israel confirms that 31 of the remaining 136 hostages in Gaza are dead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The IDF released footage of what they say are troops operating in western canyons in the Gaza Strip, as Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed to continue the war until total victory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Israel's army's spokesperson Hagari announced that the families of the hostages that have died have been notified.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The death of the hostages only adds pressure on the Israeli government and their handling of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The news came as U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken met with the leaders of Egypt and Qatar Tuesday, holding diplomatic talks to push ahead for a ceasefire. To which Qatar's prime minister said that Hamas gave a generally positive answer. Blinken will be discussing the proposal with Israel today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We are reviewing that response now and I will be discussing it with the government of Israel tomorrow. There is still a lot of work to be done, but we continue to believe that an agreement is possible and indeed essential. And we will continue to work relentlessly to achieve it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: In Gaza, Palestinians mourn and prayed by the side of people killed in recent strikes on the southernmost town of Rafah, the city previously designated a safe zone by the Israeli military and to where hundreds of thousands of Palestinians have fled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04

sentences.sentence: Aliyev's popularity increased among the Azeris after the country achieved full control of the Karabakh region from the ethnic Armenians, and as peace is now finally looming in the Caucasus. Девушки, учитывая, что это не только для нас, но и для всех, кто живет в России, will be for justice. I think justice has strengthened our republic, that we were able to return what belonged to us.

sentences.sentence: Sweden is to close its investigation into the explosions of the underwater Nord Stream gas pipelines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Its investigation was only one of three, with Denmark and Germany also examining the blasts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Officials in the Nordic nations say Sweden doesn't have the jurisdiction to investigate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The explosions happened as Europe attempted to wean itself off Russian energy sources.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: More than 16 months after the sabotage, the source of the attack remains a major international mystery, with German media blaming a pro-Ukraine group and Russia accusing the US of staging the explosions.

sentences.sentence: but these Italian farmers are as angry as their counterparts in the rest of Europe. In their eyes, the whole sector once seen as a strand of Italy's economy is not as profitable as it used to be.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Even for them, the impact of EU policies to protect the environment is too hard to handle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They see cheap foreign imports as unfair competition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Adding to that, inflation has taken its toll. We are an hour's drive away from Rome and this is one of the main groups that have assembled on the outskirts of the city. They've been here for several days already. They've been sleeping in their trucks and they're waiting for other trucks to join the protest from other parts of the country. Their goal is to hold a larger rally in the Italian capital in the next few days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They say they don't want to surrender and they're determined to reach the parliament building.

sentences.sentence: Paris Olympics chief organizer Tony Estanguet is having his pay investigated six months before the Games begin.
